docs.snippet: LEAD: MORE than a year has passed, so Oscar Schmidt can afford to be generous about Brazil's upset victory over the United States in the men's basketball final of the 10th Pan American Games. ''They had the better team,'' he said. ''In the second...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: MORE than a year has passed, so Oscar Schmidt can afford to be generous about Brazil's upset victory over the United States in the men's basketball final of the 10th Pan American Games. ''They had the better team,'' he said. ''In the second half, we grabbed our chances.''

headline.main: BRAZIL IS LOOKING FOR LUCKY DAY

docs.snippet: LEAD: Commerce Secretary C. William Verity Jr. said today that an American-Japanese free-trade agreement would not be the best way to solve the two countries' trade disputes.

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD:  GOLF  Two Share Lead: David Frost and Don Hammond, who together have only one victory in a combined 10 years on the PGA Tour, shot 67's yesterday to share the first-round lead in the $600,000 Bank of Boston Classic in Sutton, Mass. Frost, 14th...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: GOLF Two Share Lead: David Frost and Don Hammond, who together have only one victory in a combined 10 years on the PGA Tour, shot 67's yesterday to share the first-round lead in the $600,000 Bank of Boston Classic in Sutton, Mass. Frost, 14th on this year's money list with $436,140 but seeking his first Tour victory, shot 34,33-67 over the 7,110-yard Pleasant Valley Country Club course.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Henry C. Wallich, a longtime member of the Federal Reserve Board and its leading authority on international finance, died today at George Washington University Hospital. He was 74 years old and had been in failing health since undergoing...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Henry C. Wallich, a longtime member of the Federal Reserve Board and its leading authority on international finance, died today at George Washington University Hospital. He was 74 years old and had been in failing health since undergoing surgery for a brain tumor in 1985.

headline.main: Henry C. Wallich, 74, Dies; Served on Federal Reserve

byline.original: By ROBERT D. HERSHEY Jr., Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD:  Golf  Britain-Ireland Grabs Lead: Britain-Ireland, six strokes behind Sweden overnight, moved into a three-shot lead over the United States yesterday at the midway point of the men's world amateur team championship in Stockholm. Peter McEvoy...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Golf Britain-Ireland Grabs Lead: Britain-Ireland, six strokes behind Sweden overnight, moved into a three-shot lead over the United States yesterday at the midway point of the men's world amateur team championship in Stockholm. Peter McEvoy shot one-under-par 71 to lead his team. He had a 72 Thursday and held second in the individual standing.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Senate, voting 83 to 9, today approved the free-trade agreement with Canada, completing American approval three and a half years after the idea emerged from a summit meeting of President Reagan and Prime Minister Brian Mulroney.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Senate, voting 83 to 9, today approved the free-trade agreement with Canada, completing American approval three and a half years after the idea emerged from a summit meeting of President Reagan and Prime Minister Brian Mulroney.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: It might have been surprising that two South Korean boxing officials climbed into the ring and attacked a referee Thursday, but it was perhaps inevitable. South Korean officials have been sensitive about closely contested bouts since the 1984 Olympics in Los Angeles, when American fighters were beneficiaries of several favorable decisions, a couple at the expense of South

headline.main: THE SEOUL OLYMPICS: Boxing; Anger by Koreans Over '84 May Have Spurred Outburst

byline.original: By PETER ALFANO, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: AT dawn, rattling through Paraguay's rural interior on the Ferrocarril Presidente Carlos Antonio Lopez, I was dogged by the pungent aroma of burning wood - not a smell I'd previously associated with trains. Hot grease, steam, coal smoke and...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AT dawn, rattling through Paraguay's rural interior on the Ferrocarril Presidente Carlos Antonio Lopez, I was dogged by the pungent aroma of burning wood - not a smell I'd previously associated with trains. Hot grease, steam, coal smoke and diesel exhaust: those, in my experience, were proper train smells.

headline.main: By Wood Burner From Buenos Aires

byline.original: By KARL ZIMMERMANN; KARL ZIMMERMANN's latest book about trains, ''Santa Fe Streamliners'' (Quadrant Press), was published last year
